entries.title: E.U. Urges Nations to Require Negative Covid Tests for Travelers From China
entries.description: In a diplomatically fraught move, the bloc advised its 27 members to put restrictions in place as Chinese tourists prepare to return to global destinations.

entries.title: Russian Troops’ Use of Cellphones Is a Persistent, Lethal Danger
entries.description: Ukrainian artillery targets Russian soldiers by pinpointing their phone signals. Despite the deadly results, Russian troops keep defying a ban on cellphone use near the front.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing: Russia Blames its Dead Soldiers
entries.description: Also, Kim Jong-un presents a possible successor.

entries.title: Sunak Makes Sweeping Pledges to Britons, Promising Path to Prosperity
entries.description: His promises represented an effort to regain momentum at a time of steep challenges for Britain, but some pressing problems, like the National Health System, defy easy solutions.

entries.title: Some European Nations See Warmest Start to the Year Ever Measured
entries.description: Countries across the continent saw the warmest start to the year ever measured. The weather has forced ski resorts to close trails, with sparser than usual snow cover.

entries.title: Some in Europe Toasted the New Year in T-Shirts
entries.description: Countries across the continent saw the warmest start to the year ever measured. The weather has forced ski resorts to close trails, with sparser than usual snow cover.

entries.title: Actress Detained for Supporting Iranian Protests Is Released
entries.description: Taraneh Alidoosti, one of the most high-profile targets in Iran’s campaign against celebrities who have expressed solidarity with the demonstrators, was arrested on Dec. 18.

entries.title: Ahead of Pope Benedict’s Funeral, Faithful Gather in the Vatican
entries.description: Tens of thousands came to see the pope emeritus, who died on Saturday at age 95, as he lay in state for three days ahead of his funeral on Thursday.

entries.title: Russia Blames Soldiers’ Cellphone Use For Deadly Makiivka Strike
entries.description: The Defense Ministry said the use of phones helped Ukraine home in on the troops’ location, while influential military bloggers said that explanation ignored commanders’ mistakes.

entries.title: The ‘Golden Gays’ Return to the Stage in the Philippines
entries.description: They formed a community meant to support and shelter gay people who had been cast aside by society. Decades later, they are still living together, hosting pageants to help make ends meet.

entries.title: When Darkness Falls, Three Friends Find Ancient Art
entries.description: Some Norwegian hobbyists are having a great time uncovering hundreds of Bronze Age carvings. Their discoveries have lent weight to theories about what the mysterious images mean.

entries.title: A House Divided
entries.description: House Republicans are struggling with a test of governing.

entries.title: Russia Acknowledges Higher Death Toll in Donetsk Attack and Says Its Soldiers Gave Location Away
entries.description: Russia’s Defense Ministry said that despite a ban, its troops had been using their cellphones before the deadly New Year’s Day strike by Kyiv’s forces in eastern Ukraine.

entries.title: ​Is Kim Jong-un’s ‘Most Beloved Daughter’ North Korea’s Next Leader?
entries.description: Her appearances in state media, most recently in undated photos released on New Year’s Day, have triggered growing speculation about succession plans in the country.

entries.title: Read Your Way Through Tokyo
entries.description: Hiromi Kawakami, one of Japan’s most popular contemporary novelists, travels with books that help her immerse herself in her destination. Here, she suggests reading for those coming to her hometown, Tokyo.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
entries.description: Here’s what you need to know.

entries.title: Benedict Leaves a Conflicted Legacy on Clerical Sexual Abuse
entries.description: Joseph Ratzinger was accused of mishandling cases when he was bishop of Munich, but as pope he was credited with forcing the Catholic Church to face a scourge long ignored.

entries.title: Ukraine Keeps Downing Russian Drones, but Price Tag Is High
entries.description: When costly missiles take out cheap drones, the real winner over time may be the country that spends less.

entries.title: Filippo Bernardini, Accused of Stealing Book Manuscripts, Expected to Plead Guilty
entries.description: Filippo Bernardini was arrested by the F.B.I. last year. He is expected to enter his plea on Friday, ending a yearslong saga that captivated the industry.
